name: Active Minds
description: The mission of the Active Minds is to increase Southern Methodist University's students’, faculty’s, and staff’s awareness of issues surrounding mental health, symptoms related to mental health disorders, and mental health resources available both on campus and in the surrounding community.

name: Adam Smith Society
description: The Adam Smith Society SMU Cox Chapter is open to all students enrolled in a graduate program at the Cox School of Business.  This club brings together students and professionals to discuss and debate the contributions of the free market to advancing human flourishing and opportunity for all. As upcoming business leaders, we discuss the need for free enterprise and competition. We are happy to welcome graduate students pursuing business and law to come together for thoughtful discussion on economics, fiscal policy, capitalism, democracy, and so much more.    How to join the Adam Smith Society   1. Request to join here on SMU 360  2. Pay $25 dues using Venmo to @cox-clubs with a note "Dues for SMU Adam Smith Society"  **Be sure to add the name of the club in your venmo payment  3. Screenshot the payment and note!  4. Email coxadamsmithsociety@list.smu.edu with a screenshot of your payment and let us know you've registered!

name: Air & Space Law Society
description: The DFW metroplex is one of the most air and space-centric areas in the nation. While air and space travel technologies are evolving every day, a cadre of lawyers who are ready to lead the new legal word is necessary. The goal of the Air & Space Law Society is to connect students to related legal communities and to allow students to learn about the many practice areas within air and space law through networking and scholarship opportunities. Highlighted practice areas include air and space corporate counsel, transactional, litigation, Space-Force, Federal agencies, and more.

name: Alliance of Graduate International Lyle Engineers
Alpha Epsilon Delta/Pre-Health Professions Society
description: AED stands for Alpha Epsilon Delta and is a Pre Health Honor society focused on preparing students for careers in Medicine, Dentistry, Optometry, Podiatry, Veterinary Medicine and other Allied Health Professions. Our organization, SMU AED, is a chapter of the national organization and is focused on providing the pre-health community here on campus mentorship events, learning and service opportunities, and a community to connect with as they navigate their pre-health journey here at SMU.

name: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
description: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity Inc. develops leaders, promotes brotherhood and academic excellence, while providing service and advocacy for our communities.

name: American Constitution Society
description: Through a diverse nationwide network of progressive lawyers, law students, judges, scholars, advocates, and many others, our mission is to support and advocate for laws and legal systems that strengthen our democratic legitimacy, uphold the rule of law, and redress the founding failures of our Constitution and enduring inequities in our laws in pursuit of realized equality.

name: Anthropology Club of Southern Methodist University
Applied Physiology Club
category_tags: Dedman College of Humanities and Sciences,Professional

name: Asian Pacific American Law Student Association
ASL Club
description: The purpose of the ASL Club is to advocate for Deaf equality through awareness of ASL, Deaf culture, and the Deaf community.     If you would like to join, please join this page and follow the link to our Linktree. You will find our Google Form sign-up and our GroupMe link - please do both!  https://linktr.ee/smuaslclub

name: Association for Public Interest Law
description: APIL is a group of SMU law students committed to public service. Each year, APIL raises money to provide stipends for law students who are interning for nonprofit agencies or public interest organizations during the summer. APIL stipends allow future lawyers to gain community-minded experience and training and provide much needed legal assistance to charitable organizations and their clients.

name: Association of Latino Professionals For America
description: ALPFA (Association of Latino Professionals for America) is a professional business organization dedicated to empowering students by providing valuable opportunities for leadership development, professional growth, and community engagement. By connecting members with local and national professionals, ALPFA offers guidance, mentorship, and networking opportunities that prepare our members for successful careers in various industries, while fostering a strong, inclusive community on campus. Open to all majors.

name: Athletes in Action
description: To see a Christ-follower on EVERY team, in EVERY sport, and in EVERY athletic department at SMU and across DFW, so that God can use sport to create spiritual movements on campus, in the community, and around the world.

name: Athletes United
description: The vision of Athletes United is to unite the hearts of coaches and athletes with Jesus Christ.   Our mission is the Great Commission: "Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age." Matthew 28:19-20

name: Bangladesh Student Association
description: The primary purposes of the Bangladeshi Student Association is to:    A. Promote cultural, economic, and intellectual awareness of Bangladesh to our SMU community.    B. Plan and execute social activities around the SMU campus to increase diversity.

name: Baptist Student Ministry
description: To transform the lives of students through discipleship and send them out to every corner of campus and around the world to make disciples and live for Jesus in their communities.

name: Bhakti Yoga, Meditation, and Philosophy Club
description: To help students in finding peace through meditation and other spiritual techniques. To create a community of spiritualists to share experiences together. To discuss spiritual values and topics in an open forum, and study Vedic texts. To propagate devotion to God. To empower students with spiritual leadership and foundation.

name: Black Business Organization
description: The black  business organization, also known as BBO is a club at SMU that specializes in the professional development and advancement of minority students at SMU     What we offer is a community and network of students and professionals who want to help grow and nourish black excellence on the campus of SMU     We also provide opportunities for students to gain insight into the college-to-workforce transitions and industry experiences from professionals through our company informational sessions and panel discussions.    In addition to that we inform students about internship opportunities with the different companies that come and speak with us.

name: Board Together
description: Calling all board game enthusiasts!  We are a new board game club at the university offering an inclusive, fun space to meet new friends, connect with existing ones, and have a great time over classic and modern board game offerings. In joining our club you will be joining a low-stress tight-knit community focused on friendly competition, memorable experiences, and lasting friendships.

name: Boaz Commons
description: Community | Compassion | Integrity | Mentorship | Zeal    "At Boaz Commons, we believe in family. We believe in sharing life together. We believe in celebrating each other's A+ papers and game-winning shots. We believe in supporting each other through the hard times and growing with each other through the tough moments. We believe in the importance of sharing lemonade on the front porch and gathering around the dinner table for a meal. We believe in neighbors becoming friends and friends becoming family." - Hiram Abiff Boaz

name: Cask & Barrel Club
description: The purpose of the Cask & Barrel Club is to promote community among all Cox Graduate Business Students and to create a supportive environment while increasing students' knowledge, respect and enthusiasm for wine, spirits and craft beer.

name: Catholic Campus Ministry at SMU
description: Catholic Campus Ministry at SMU is a home for forming Servant Leaders through an intentional and personal relationship with Jesus Christ through His Church.    Our Masses are on Sundays at 9:00 am & 5:00 pm in Perkins Chapel and 8:00 pm at the Catholic Center (3057 University Blvd).

name: Chabad
description: Chabad at SMU is about providing a home away from home where you can be your most comfortable and inspired Jewish self.

name: Chinese Language Club
description: Chinese Language Club aims to create a community among SMU students that is passionate about learning the Chinese language and culture. Our organization provides students with free resources, in collaboration with SMU's Chinese Department, to further their Chinese skills. CLC also fosters community among Chinese learners, creating spaces where students can practice speaking with one another, join our study sessions to complete coursework together, and find friends at any of our socials. Through our larger events, we emphasize the interconnectedness of language and culture by sharing Chinese holidays and points of celebration, while also sharing relevant Chinese phrases and traditions.

name: Circle K International.
description: Developing college and university students into a global network of responsible citizens and leaders with a lifelong commitment to service.

name: Club Baseball
description: To play the world's purest form of baseball with your best friends

name: Club Rugby
description: Dedicated to creating a great community and sharing the love of rugby.

name: Consulting & Corporate Strategy Club
description: The Consulting and Corporate Strategy club is a Cox graduate club open to all students enrolled in a graduate program at the Cox School of Business. Join the club to learn more about the consulting career, build case prep skills, and connect with students and alumni in the industry. The club leads regular case prep sessions and sponsors networking happy hours each mod.     We would love see all those returning faces and meet you if you're new. Be sure to reach out if you have any questions.     How to join the Consulting & Corporate Strategy Club  1. Request to join here on SMU 360  2. Pay $50 dues using Venmo to @cox-clubs with a note "Dues for Consulting & Corporate Strategy Club"  **Be sure to add the name of the club in your venmo payment  3. Screenshot the payment and note!  4. Email coxconsultingclub@list.smu.edu with a screenshot of your payment and let us know you've registered!    Dues help fund the happy hour and networking events

name: Counselors for Social Justice
category_tags: Simmons School of Education and Human Development

name: Cox Graduate Entrepreneurship Club
description: The SMU Cox Graduate Entrepreneurship Club, founded in 2000, is a student-led organization dedicated to promoting innovation within the SMU community. The Cox Graduate Entrepreneurship club fosters opportunities for student club members to achieve their goals of starting and launching a viable business, exploring venture capital interest, supporting a startup, or inspiring entrepreneurial thinking. The Cox Graduate Entrepreneurship club provides members with resources, hands-on support from the SMU entrepreneurship community, mentorship, and support from the Dallas startup community.

name: Cox Graduate Marketing Club
description: The Graduate Marketing Club exists to:  1. Promote professional growth and development, marketing excellence, and community among all Cox Graduate Business students  2. Provide support and resources to students searching for, applying to, and interviewing for internship and full-time marketing related positions  3. Foster relationships with companies, administration, and faculty to improve the business student experience

name: Cox Graduate Women in Business
description: The purpose of the Graduate Women in Business Club is to support our network of friendships and resources for women and allies within the Cox Graduate Programs. Graduate Women in Business will empower women and members thru powerful networking events. Our mission is to promote the role of women in business through forums for sharing information, resources, concerns, and strategies for change.

name: Data Analytics Club
description: An inclusive community for SMU students interested in data analytics, fostering collaboration and innovation through learning, skill building, networking, and professional development

name: Debate
description: "Veritas Liberabit Vos" - SMU Motto    SMU's motto, "Veritas Liberabit Vos," translates to, "the truth will make you free." At SMU Speech & Debate, our mission reflects this motto. Predicated on the life and works of the great debater James Farmer Jr., our program utilizes the practices of debate and public speaking to allow students to speak to their personal truth while developing as professionals.

name: Dedman Graduate Student Assembly
category_tags: Dedman College of Humanities and Sciences

name: Dedman Law Office of Diversity & Inclusion
Dedman Law Office of Student Affairs
Dedman Law Robert B. Rowling Center for Business Law & Leadership
Dedman Law Tsai Center for Law, Science and Innovation
Drone & Unmanned Autonomous Vehicle Club
description: The primary objective of the Drone & UAV Club is to facilitate practical engagement with unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) by organizing events, workshops, and competitions aimed at fostering learning and advancement. Additionally, the club seeks to impart knowledge on UAV safety and regulations to its members, as well as to promote the development of teamwork and leadership skills in the management of UAV-related projects.

name: Duck Unlimited
description: We are a nonprofit organization that informs students about the importance of conserving our wetlands and how people can actively support conservation causes. This club will also raise money for D.U. and help give back to the local environment and community. This club will also be a great way for people to make new friends and meet each other, as we will be partnering with the Dallas D.U. chapter for big projects.

name: Earth Focus
description: To generate sustainable outcomes on SMU's campus and beyond, including carbon neutrality, ecosystem conservation, and waste minimization, by educating, inspiring, mobilizing, and assisting communities to choose thoughtful, eco-friendly actions and sustainable systems.

name: Energy, Environment & Natural Resources Law Society
description: EENRLS's mission it to serve a platform for its student members to connect with practitioners, entities and professionals in the areas of energy, environment, and natural resources and develop client-service and relational skills, professional development, and acquire knowledge on these traditional technical competencies so that its members specialize in these areas of the law. EENRLS seeks to educate and engage students on issues related to environmental protection and energy regulation. We host events and discussions to explore energy, environmental, and natural resources law and provide opportunities for students to develop expertise in this field through networking with professionals.

name: EPIC Movement
description: A community of Asian-Americans in pursuit of knowing Christ, growing in relationship with Him, and sharing the Gospel.

name: Esports Club
description: Our mission is to provide a fun, social space for the many video game players of all skill levels and interests at SMU through organized events; we want to promote the growth of the esports community and camaraderie among all gamers.

name: Federalist Society
description: The Federalist Society for Law and Public Policy Studies is a group of conservative and libertarian lawyers and law students founded on the principles that the state exists to preserve freedom, that the separation of governmental powers is central to our Constitution, and that it is emphatically the province and duty of the judiciary to say what the law is, not what the law should be.     The SMU Federalist Society seeks to promote awareness and foster fair and open debate about these principles in the SMU Law School community and beyond. Every year, we host scholars, judges, and practitioners to debate and discuss a range of law and policy topics.    The Federalist Society is about ideas. We do not lobby for legislation, take policy positions, or endorse candidates for public office. Our members hold diverse and often conflicting views on a broad range of issues.

name: Feminist Equality Movement
description: The Feminist Equality Movement is a collection of SMU students and faculty who exist to dismantle the assumption that gender and sex are defined roles in society. FEM is designed to create an intersectional, inclusive, and affirming understanding of feminism through programming and activism. All programming will be devised with the intention to raise the voices of those who have been excluded and underheard. FEM will maintain a standard of advocacy and support for all persons on the SMU campus, specifically survivors of gender-based and asexual violence.

name: Filipino Student Association
description: The SMU Filipino Student Association (FSA) is dedicated to fostering an inclusive community that celebrates Filipino culture, heritage, and values. Through cultural events, social gatherings, and community service, we aim to educate, empower, and connect students while promoting leadership and personal growth. Above all, we invite everyone to "Sumali sa Pamilya"—join the family—and share in the warmth, traditions, and spirit of our community.

name: FOCUS
description: Looking for authentic friendships and loving community? Focus is a Christian campus ministry devoted to developing passionate followers of Jesus who love God and people.

name: Foundations Investment Club
description: The Foundations Investment Club aims to educate members on the core principles of investing, fostering a collaborative environment where participants can deepen their understanding of market dynamics, financial analysis, and investment strategies, ultimately empowering them to make informed and confident financial decisions.

name: Game Development Club
description: We aim to create a space for anyone interested in creating video games, no matter their experience level. We provide opportunities to learn about game development, collaborate on game projects, or just interact with others with similar interests. The experience gained and projects created here will be useful in getting employed in the industry.    All disciplines are welcome! Whether you are an artist, programmer, 3D modeler, creative writer, music composer, all of the above, or none of the above, we are sure you will find a place in our community.    Club events will be held regularly. These include game nights, development workshops, game jams, and more!     Join our discord server to stay updated: https://discord.gg/j6rQTEXjAg.

name: Global Medical Brigades
description: SMU Global Medical Brigades (GMB) provides students an opportunity to travel abroad and practice their medical skills through hands on experience while serving underpriviledged communities.

name: Hillel at SMU
description: Hillel at SMU is the Jewish home away from home for our 500 Jewish Mustangs. We value meaningful relationships, joyful learning, the celebration of Jewish life and the development of leaders who are world changers.

name: Hilltop Investment in Healthcare
description: Empowering the next generation of finance leaders by investing in innovative healthcare solutions, driving impactful advancements to improve global health outcomes.

name: Hispanic Law Student Association
description: Empowering Hispanic law students to thrive academically, professionally, and socially within the legal community. Through advocacy, education, and cultural enrichment, we strive to foster an inclusive environment that celebrates diversity, promotes leadership, and advocates for equity and justice in the legal field and beyond.

name: Housing Unification Board
description: The Purpose of the Housing Unification Board (HUB) is to support SMU residential communities in the development and enhancement of initiatives and traditions including the annual Commons Cup competition.

name: Inspire NextGen
description: Inspire NextGen is a 501c3 nonprofit organization focused on tutoring and mentoring to underprivileged students from around the world. Our mission is to help students grow as leaders, provide mentorship, and academically excel.

name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Student Branch
description: Campus student chapter for the official professional organization Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

name: Intellectual Property Organization
description: The IPO aims to offer our fellow law students a comprehensive understanding of intellectual property (IP) law, including patent, trademark, copyright, and trade secret law. Through events hosted throughout the year, the IPO also serves as a career base for students interested in IP law as we aim to connect students to practicing IP attorneys and inform students about IP associate positions and opportunities.

name: International Business Club
description: To serve as a multicultural bridge between the SMU Cox talent. We aim to increase opportunities for International Students in the American business culture as well as students exploring careers abroad.

name: International Law Society
description: The International Law Society aims to connect law students to the international law network, to bring awareness to the issues facing the modern international law practice, and to educate our members about the various facets of practice in international law.

name: Kpop Club
description: Kpop Club is a student-run, arts-oriented organization that strives to create a community which  focuses on exploring music within the Kpop genre, teaching Kpop choreographies, and discussing the artistic qualities behind Kpop performances while garnering interest and appreciation towards Korean arts culture.

name: League of United Latin American Citizens
Liberty in North Korea at SMU
description: Liberty in North Korea is an international NGO working with the North Korean people as they achieve their liberty. LiNK helps North Korean refugees escape through a 3,000-mile secret rescue route and empowers North Koreans who have reached freedom to be changemakers, advocates, and leaders on this issue.

name: Mary Hay, Peyton, and Shuttles Commons
McElvaney Commons
description: McElvaney Commons is a community of friends, family, and lifelong learners. Here we live by the motto of Ubuntu which in Bantu means "I am, because of who we all are." By joining McElvaney Commons, you join a great community where you are never far from a friend. McElvaney is your home away from home, where you will grow and create memories that will last a lifetime!

name: Men's Soccer Club
description: SMU Men's Soccer Club competes in the Texas Collegiate Soccer League (TCSL) and fields a committed and competitive team each year. Our team competes in the Premier Conference playing against teams such as UT, Texas A&M, Baylor, Texas State, UTSA, Tulsa, and many other schools.

name: Middle Eastern and South Asian Law Student Association
Middle Eastern North African Student Association
Minority Association of Pre-Health Students
description: MAPS is Southern Methodist University’s undergraduate chapter of the Student National Medical Association, better known as SNMA. MAPS is committed to supporting current and future minority pre-health students, addressing the needs of underserved communities, and increasing the number of clinically excellent, culturally competent and socially conscious healthcare professionals.

name: Morrison-McGinnis Commons
description: MoMac Manta Rays  Individually Unique, Together Complete.  Community, Acceptance, Character.

name: Multicultural Greek Council
description: The Multicultural Greek Council, or MGC, is the governing body of four multicultural fraternity and sorority chapters at SMU: Kappa Delta Chi, Omega Delta Phi, Sigma Lambda Beta, and Sigma Lambda Gamma. Students from these organizations come from various backgrounds and ethnicities and work together to create a community that unites students of all cultures at SMU.

name: Mustang Ballroom Dance Club
description: Mustang Ballroom Dance Club strives to educate its members on Ballroom and Latin dancing in a fun and friendly environment. We offer classes from beginner to advanced (no previous experience is required). We also participate in competitions around Texas.

name: Mustang Book Buzz
description: Mustang Book Buzz is a dynamic, student-led book club where passionate readers come together to dive into captivating stories and lively discussions. Meeting once a month at 5:00PM on Mondays, this club offers a relaxed and engaging atmosphere for students to explore new genres, share insights, and connect with fellow book enthusiasts.    Whether you're a voracious reader or just looking to discover your next great read, Mustang Book Buzz is the perfect place to expand your literary horizons and enjoy thought-provoking conversations. Come for the books, stay for the camaraderie—everyone’s welcome!

name: Mustang EMS
description: Mustang EMS is dedicated to providing first aid, CPR, and emergency preparedness education to everyone on campus through monthly skills sessions, CPR/AED and Stop the Bleed certification classes, and monthly blood drives. Mustang EMS also encourages members to attend an accredited Emergency Medical Technician (EMT-B) certification class, which equips students to respond to medical emergencies ranging from bleeding control to oxygen administration and CPR.

name: Mustang Rocketry
description: The purpose of this club shall be:  1. To develop, design, build, and test rockets, drones, model airplanes, and aerospace technologies for research and competition;  2. To allow aspiring engineers and scientists to create connections with industry experts;  3. To foster a supportive, mentor-mentee environment for undergraduate students;  4. To give aspiring engineers and scientists hands-on experience in both design and fabrication processes as well as experiments and the experimental

name: Mustang Running Club
description: At the heart of the Mustang Running Club, our mission is simple yet profound: to cultivate a thriving community of runners among students and faculty alike. Whether you're lacing up your running shoes for the first time or you're an experienced marathoner, our club is here to support, motivate, and inspire you on your fitness journey.

name: Mustangs for Christ (Preston Road Church of Christ)
Mustangs for Israel
description: Promoting Israel advocacy while committed to combating antisemitism. A fair and balanced approach.

name: National Association of Black Accountants at SMU
Net Impact
description: SMU Cox Net Impact is a community of professional leaders creating positive social and environmental change in the workplace and the world (netimpact.org). We promote a triple bottom line as part of business: people, profit, and planet. We collaborate with businesses, government industries, non-profits, and individuals to advance strategic solutions to global and community-based problems. Cox Net Impact events include the annual, national Net Impact Conference, and speaker events with area corporate leaders in ESG and CSR. Some upcoming events will also include high-level volunteer opportunities, happy hours, and collaborative networking with various Institutes and non-profits.

name: Non-Traditional Law Students Association
description: The Non-Traditional Law Students Association is dedicated to meeting the needs and concerns of the non-traditional SMU Dedman Law student, including but not limited to married students, students with children, caregivers, veterans, those who hold full time jobs and/or are returning to school from the position of an established career, and part-time and evening students.

name: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
description: Orthodox Christian Fellowship (OCF) is a pan-Orthodox organization dedicated to exploring the Orthodox Christian faith, fostering spiritual growth, and exposing the campus to the faith, cultures, and customs that are unique to our 2000-year-old tradition.     All those interested in learning about Orthodoxy, including non-Orthodox Christians, are welcome!

name: Panhellenic Council
description: The SMU Panhellenic Council exists as the governing body over the seven National Panhellenic Conference (NPC) sororities located on our campus. The Council is comprised of seven executive officers and seven chapter delegates and junior delegates. It is the responsibility of the Council to unite all seven chapters in the spirit of Greek unity, to enforce the NPC guidelines, and to oversee and regulate the recruitment process. The Council works year-round to promote positive ideals of sorority life at SMU, and contribute to the SMU community through involvement, leadership, academic, philanthropic projects, school spirit, and overall support. Sororities were among the first organizations at SMU founded during 1915, with Alpha Omicron Pi, Phi Mu, and Alpha Delta Pi being the first three chapters to colonize. The growth of the SMU Panhellenic Council was prolific during the twenties and thirties, and over time SMU has hosted 15 different NPC chapters.

name: Phi Alpha Delta Pre-Law
description: We strive for a shared devotion to compassion, professionalism, and service to continuously better our profession and our communities.

name: Phi Delta Phi Legal Honor Society
Poetry Club
description: We aim to foster a fun, casual, enriching environment for the creation and intellectual discussion of poetry. Whether you are pursuing creative writing or literature as a career or you simply enjoy poetry in your free time, everybody is welcome to join! We have a range of activities, from analyzing poetic techniques in published poems to writing your own poetry. By becoming a member, you can meet likeminded students at SMU and grow as a poet or reader!    To join Poetry Club and stay up to date with meeting times, join our GroupMe below:  https://groupme.com/join_group/93364702/bdpe0xe1

name: Polo Club
description: SMU Polo Club is a student organization ran by officers elected by our members.     Founded in 2013 by Enrique Ituarte, the clubs focus is developing experienced riders in more methodical players and also teaching polo basics to newcomers. We welcome anyone to join our club who has riding experience. No equipment required! We will provide everything from the horse to the helmet!     SMU Polo competes on a local and national level, with the hopes of qualifying for the National Championships each school year!

name: Pre-Dental Society
description: The Pre-Dental Society is dedicated to supporting students interested in pursuing a career in dentistry. Our mission is to provide resources, networking opportunities, and hands-on experiences to help members prepare for dental school and the field of dentistry. Through workshops, guest speakers, volunteer activities, and mentorship programs, we aim to foster a community of aspiring dental professionals and promote academic and professional growth.

name: Prevent and Protect Project
description: Originally founded through SMU Student Senate’s Wellness Committee, the Prevent and Protect Project is committed to raising awareness about the dangers of fentanyl, emphasizing the importance of Narcan education and promoting its responsible usage through education, awareness, and community engagement.

name: Pride@Cox
description: Pride@Cox is a student organization at SMU's Cox School of Business dedicated to supporting lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and questioning (LGBTQ+) MBA students and their partners. Our mission is to cultivate community, promote professional growth, and champion LGBTQ+ representation within our school and the broader business world.

name: Private Credit Club
description: The SMU Private Credit Club is dedicated to fostering a deep understanding of the private credit industry among students. Our mission is to provide members with insights into direct lending, distressed debt, mezzanine financing, and other facets of the private credit market. We aim to bridge the gap between academic knowledge and real-world applications by offering networking opportunities, educational workshops, and guest speaker events featuring industry professionals.

name: Private Equity & Venture Capital Club
description: Our goal at PEVC is to introduce and educate our members about Private Equity and Venture Capital through speaker events and a comprehensive education series.

name: Program Council
description: The purpose of Program Council is to unify and celebrate the community found in the SMU student body through fun, innovative and educational programming that enhances the awareness of self, of others and of the entire university community. Program Council is comprised of several committees each with its own committee chair. So, whatever your passion, Program Council has a place for you!

name: Psi Chi
category_tags: Dedman College of Humanities and Sciences,Professional

name: Scholars of Finance
description: SOF seeks to solve the world’s largest problems by investing in undergraduate students through leadership development, mentorship, and the active support of hundreds of purpose-driven finance executives and investors

name: Senate Organizations Committee
description: The Organizations Committee exists for the purpose of oversight, regulation, and support of student organizations.    -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                         Looking to start an org?                                                  Use this: smu.edu/startanorg                                                         Already have a charter?                       Use this for event planning and financing: smu.edu/theguide    Link to Sample Constitution/Bylaws: https://smu.box.com/s/kxijmavgog04qf0s9oouroobhrjerz9m

name: Sigma Lambda Gamma National Sorority, Inc.
Simmons Graduate Council
category_tags: Simmons School of Education and Human Development

name: SMU Daily Campus
description: The mission of The Daily Campus is to serve as the independent voice of the SMU community as responsive student media in a learning environment dedicated to excellence, student freedom of expression as guaranteed under the under First Amendment and sound creative and business practices appropriate to a university community.

name: SMU Law Walking and Running Club
SMU Rang Elite Non-Competing Dance Team
Society for Russian Studies at Southern Methodist University
South Asian Student Association
description: SMU SASA is an organization established to unite the undergraduate and graduate students who relate  to and/or want to celebrate South Asian culture at Southern Methodist University, while raising awareness of its culture within  the community. It is also our goal to involve our members in the Dallas area through philanthropic and  cultural activities. It is our mission to ensure that the voice and concerns of our members be heard  through this organization.

name: Southern Gentlemen
description: The mission of Southern Gentlemen is to bring musical entertainment to SMU's campus and the Dallas area while providing student members with social and artistic opportunities for enjoyment and growth.

name: State Bar of Texas Law Student Division
Student Foundation
description: Student Foundation seeks to instill pride in the students of Southern Methodist University and create a sense of community through traditions and programs that serve the University. SF plans and executes four events throughout the year that include Family Weekend, Homecoming, Celebration of Lights, and PerunaPalooza. Our goal is to unify the student body by creating welcoming experiences and opportunities for all Mustangs.

name: Student Senate
description: The purpose of SMU’s Student Senate is to establish a forum to represent all students, act as a communicative body among the students, administration, and faculty, protect the rights of students by ensuring a student voice in every decision-making process of the university, establish policies which govern the actions of students, and promote opportunities for intellectual growth.

name: Students for New Learning
description: Our mission is to provide information, resources and networking opportunities to help neurodivergent SMU students.  Neurodivergence is here defined as disorders and/or disabilities that alter a person’s ability to thrive to his/her fullest potential in a learning environment. These include, but are not limited to, students with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), learning disabilities (LD) of listening, speaking, reading, writing, or mathematical type, and Autism (ASD).  We also provide these opportunities to those friends and family of said SMU students.  Our mission is to provide hope and empowerment to our members and to raise awareness of neurodiversity in the SMU campus and surrounding community.

name: The Belle Tones
description: The SMU Belle Tones is the premier all-female a cappella group at SMU. The Belles come from a variety of majors including Political Science, Chemistry, Finance, Vocal Performance, and Computer Science, but are tied together by friendship and their love for music. The Belles have captured the hearts of many throughout their decade of existence and are thrilled to announce the release of their next album, coming Fall 2023!

name: The Big Event
description: Our mission at The Big Event is to empower and unify the SMU student body and greater pool of volunteers with impactful service experiences that foster personal growth and community betterment. Through fun and engaging opportunities, we aim to cultivate a culture of compassion and awareness, leaving a lasting positive impact on the Dallas community. As a cornerstone of SMU's broader mission, we strive to inspire a generation of Mustangs dedicated to making a difference, embodying the spirit of world-changers and ensuring our city thrives long after students’ departure.

name: The Blockchain Club
description: The Blockchain Club at SMU is dedicated to educating and inspiring students to learn more about blockchain technology and its applications. Our mission is to create a community where members can connect and collaborate with each other, and to prepare them for the future of work by providing them with the skills and knowledge needed to succeed in the blockchain industry.

name: The Classical Studies Club
description: Classical Studies Club introduces classical cultures to SMU students. We create a collaborative space to learn more about and interact with classical studies. We study traditional Latin and Greek cultures, as well as other classical era cultures such as Egyptian, Persian, and the Far East. Ultimately, the club is a relaxed way to learn more about history with others.

name: The College Democrats
description: The College Democrats is here to promote a space for students within and outside of the Democratic Party to discuss and debate issues freely.  Despite the organization’s political lean, we welcome any and all to our organization to discuss the issues. Our goal for the organization is to create a platform for local involvement, on-campus political engagement, and in-group discussions on policy, breaking news events, and ideas.

name: The Dialogue Society
description: The Dialogue Society aims to cultivate a vision by bridging meaningful connections  between past experiences and future aspirations. One of the Dialogue Society’s goals is to  develop leadership skills that can be used by students throughout their school and career  life.

name: The Public Relations Student Society of America
The Third Amendment Society: Students Against Quartering Soldiers
Traders
description: Traders is the premier trading and financial markets club at Southern Methodist University. We're dedicated to educating and empowering students interested in trading, investing, and financial markets.

name: UKirk
description: UKirk SMU is a worshiping community that looks for the sacred in the ordinary.    We seek to follow God by wrestling with holy scripture, gathering weekly around the table for communion, and striving to embody Jesus’s unconditional love in the world.          UKirk SMU is a place where you are invited to come as you are.  Bring your doubts and questions, your fears and past experiences, your dreams and wonderings.    Bring your whole self. We are fully inclusive of LGBTQIA+ people and we strive to be an anti-racist community. We celebrate and embrace all people, exactly how they are.    All of who you are is welcome here.         UKirk SMU is a place of nourishment, care, and support.    College is hard – this is a community where you can rest, eat (vegetarian and gluten-free options are always available!), de-stress, and connect in meaningful ways with people who care.         UKirk SMU is a place where all belong.

name: United States Military Veterans of SMU
Veterans in Business
description: The Veterans in Business Club is an SMU Cox Graduate Club open to all students enrolled in a graduate program at the Cox School of Business. The Veterans in Business Club is also open to all students enrolled at the Dedman School of Law.    Our overall mission here is to provide an area for veteran data sharing, mentorship, and collaboration; be it transitioning, disability, schoolwork, industry, interview prep, networking, etc.    We'll post events through here periodically, but feel free to use this platform as an area to post questions, comments, concerns.    How to join the Veterans in Business Club:  1. Request to join here on SMU360  2. Pay $50 dues using Venmo to @cox-clubs with a note "Dues for Veterans in Business Club"  **Be sure to add the name of the club in your Venmo payment  3. Screenshot that payment and shoot a note to the club officers at wsglenn@smu.edu, cessary@smu.edu, and bhcampbell@smu.edu    Dues will help fund club happy hours and events throughout the 2024-2025 academic school year.

name: Water Polo Club

name: Water Ski Team at SMU
description: The purpose of the Mustang Skiers shall be to help provide the opportunity for Southern Methodist University Students to compete in NCWSA-sanctioned collegiate water skiing competitions, as well as the resources needed to learn how to waterski while providing them with access to a group in which to have fun and build lifelong, shared-interest relationships.

name: Watermark College
description: We help 18-22 year-olds follow Jesus and experience the abundant life he has to offer.

name: Wesley House
description: Create Deeply Devoted Followers of Jesus Christ Amongst College Students

name: Women's Health Initiative
description: The Women's Health Initiative is dedicated to raising awareness and advocating for the health and well-being of women in our community and beyond. Our mission is to educate, support, and empower women by providing resources, hosting informative events, and fundraising for essential health services and research. We strive to create a supportive environment where women can access the knowledge and care they need to lead healthy, fulfilling lives. Through collaboration, advocacy, and community engagement, we aim to break down barriers to women's health and ensure that every woman has the opportunity to thrive.

name: Young Americans for Freedom at SMU
description: From Young America's Foundation Website:    "Young America’s Foundation is committed to ensuring that increasing numbers of young Americans understand and are inspired by the ideas of individual freedom, a strong national defense, free enterprise, and  traditional values.    "Young Americans for Freedom is the chapter affiliate of YAF. Whether you’re already a part of an existing Young Americans for Freedom chapter or just discovering the Conservative Movement, we invite you to become an official member of Young Americans for Freedom."

name: Graduate Cox Sports & Entertainment Business Association
Wellbeing Student Education Team (WEST) Member
description:
Being part of the Wellbeing Education Student Team (WEST) is a paid student leadership opportunity. WEST is part of the Office of Wellbeing, created in 2022, and will engage with the SMU community through peer to peer education. Our approach to campus wellbeing is proactive, interactive and creative. The role:
Liaison to a Residential Commons and provide wellbeing programming
Work with fellow WESTies to create campus-wide wellbeing programs
Create wellbeing workshops that can be given to student groups as well as in classrooms
Create content for an online wellbeing blog
Develop new and innovative ways to encourage wellbeing among the SMU community
Evaluate WEST programming
Market WEST programs

name: Cultivate
description: In this semester-long program for juniors and seniors, you will meet weekly to discuss readings based on the SMU Leadership Framework. Through these discussions, you will gain a deeper understanding of yourself and your role as leaders in an individual, organizational, and community context.

name: Emerging Leaders
description: The Emerging Leaders program is a leadership development program for first-year, first semester students. In weekly meetings, you will explore on-campus leadership at SMU. Through hands-on activities and discussions, you will learn about how your campus leadership experiences can prepare you to be a world changer.

name: Caswell Leadership Fellows
description: In this year-long academic program, you will refine your leadership skills while planning and implementing an impact project. An impact project is something you are passionate about within the campus or Dallas community. You will receive project funding up to $2,500, complete weekly paid office hours to work on your project and participate in leadership workshops.

name: Caswell Leadership Coaches
description: In the Caswell Leadership Coach Program, experienced student leaders engage in peer-to-peer leadership development to help students become more effective within their SMU organizations. Coaches act as consultants to help student org leaders with event planning, the Senate chartering process, org turnover, and more. Students can access Coaches on Connect.SMU.

name: Orientation Leader
description: The orientation leader position is for freshmen through senior students. Being an orientation leader is a high-profile position where you get to network internally at SMU and learn many key skills to be successful for the rest of your college career and beyond. The work is demanding but rewarding and many times you meet some of your best friends at SMU. The expectations for this position is teamwork, oral communication, professionalism, problem solving, and personal growth.

name: Stampede Guide
description: The stampede guide position is pivotal in not only Stampede, but in the transition for the first-year students to get acclimated with SMUs campus, resources, and cultivating a friendly environment. Stampede Guides get to move onto campus early to be there for training and prepare for the students to come later in the week.

name: Community Engagement Ambassador
description: The office of Social Change and Community Engagement prioritizes community engagement. The Community Engagement Ambassador Program will act as unifying agents for community engagement at SMU, promote best practices for community engagement across campus, serve as campus educators regarding key service concepts, and intentionally support the efforts of SMUs service-related organizations.
contact: Danielle Palomo, Community Engagement Coordinator SCIE

name: CONNECT Student Coordinator
description: The Student Coordinator for the Connect Mentorship Program is responsible for assisting professional SCIE staff in developing the Connect Mentorship Program. The student in the role must understand the purpose of the Connect Mentorship Program, be able to make creative suggestions in the interest of the program, and have a passion for the SCIEs mission and understanding of our vision.
contact: Cheyenne Murray, Associate Director of SCIE

name: CONNECT Mentor
description: The Connect Mentorship Program aids incoming students of color to become effective, successful, and engaged members of SMU through peer mentoring. Throughout the program, mentors help incoming students develop personally and academically by introducing them to various resources and learning opportunities offered on campus. In addition, returning students serve as mentors to incoming students. Mentors will be your guide during the Connect Institute before classes start and will continue to meet with you throughout the year as needed.
contact: Cheyenne Murray, Associate Director of SCIE

name: Resident Assistant
description:
The Resident Assistant (RA) is a student leader who is employed by the Department of
Residence Life and Student Housing (RLSH) to live in the residential community and to
work as part of a team in order to foster a student experience where every student
belongs, learns, and connects through their residential community. The RA serves as
the link between the residents of the floor and the University. The RA reports directly to
the Residential Community Director (RCD).
The RA is expected to know the individual students on their floor on a personal basis
and to advise individuals and groups of students on academic and personal matters.
Each RA is expected to create and encourage activities and programs that enhance
community and meet residents' personal and academic needs.
The RA serves as a role model for students in every aspect of University life and is
expected to know the various campus services available to students. Each RA is
expected to guide their residents in the understanding of community standards, as well
as uphold and follow University policies and procedures.
RAs uphold the values of SMU and the Division of Student Affairs to promote the
mission of RLSH and embody the values of their Commons or Community.

name: Honor Council
description: The SMU Honor Council, through the SMU Honor Code, oversees the academic conduct of all undergraduate and graduate students at SMU with the exception of those graduate students who are enrolled in the Schools of Business, Education, Law, and Theology. The Council is advised by the Director of Student Conduct and Community Standards.

name: University Conduct Board Member
description: The University Conduct Board (UCB) adjudicates alleged policy violations and promotes the Student Code of Conduct.

name: Spiritual Life Mentors
description: The Spiritual Life Mentors are a team of multi-faith student leaders who provide listening presence to students in the Commons through programming, 1-1 meetings, and small group settings. The Spiritual Life Mentor program seeks to offer care to students, challenge them to grow personally, and promote spaces of belonging for all students. Spiritual life mentors help connect a peers personal experience to their purpose in life so that they find meaning not only in what they do but in who they are. Learn more about the Spiritual Life Mentors program.

name: Student Office Coordinator
description: The Student Office Coordinators are part-time student assistants who will assist with the  day to day office operations of the OCRL, event preparation, and digital platforms. These positions work up to 20  hours per week. Primary hours take place during normal business hours (Monday-Friday 8:30 AM-5:00 PM) with occasional evening hours. Specific work hours are negotiable. As part of the OCRL team, Student Office Coordinators will be able to implement the mission of the department through propelling vision into action. These students gain experience in office administration, program planning and coordination, and critical thinking.

name: Civil Rights Pilgrimage Student Leader
description: The Civil Rights Pilgrimage Student Leader works with OCRL and SCIE staff to plan and lead the Dr. Dennis Simon Civil Rights Pilgrimage during the Spring Semester. Tasks include communicating with student participants, leading pre-trip meetings, working with local hosts on arrangements, and building community among students.

name: Cooper-McElvaney Peace & Justice Fellows
description: The aim of the Cooper-McElvaney Peace & Justice Fellowship is to encourage students to do service work and/or research in the areas of peace and justice, locally and globally.  The Fellowship provides opportunities for students at SMU to pursue their passions while integrating the desire for a just and peace-filled world. The Fellowship is a 6-week service-based learning experience (ideally over the summer) designed to allow students to work for peace and justice with a faith-based organization in their chosen field.  Each Fellow will be matched with a mentor who is involved in peace and justice work and will provide advice and model a life of peace and justice integrated with ones career.

name: Hughes-Trigg Student Center Worker
description: Serves as a representative of HTSC Staff, providing information and guidance to building guests; Building inspections for tidiness and cleanliness; Assists event setups/teardowns

name: FSLead-Leadership Class for FSL Community Members
description: FSLead is a five-week leadership series aimed at helping emerging leaders develop personal leadership, network with members in other chapters/councils, and support the pillars of SMU Fraternity & Sorority Life. This experience is open to any members that are freshman, sophomores, or juniors. It's intended for students who plan to hold leadership positions within the FSL & SMU communities.

name: Engage Dallas Student Director
description: The Engage Dallas Student Director leads their respective Commons in service around their community-identified need and is their Commons point of contact for all things Engage Dallas. Student Directors plan and execute service events and educate the community about culturally conscious serving in South and West Dallas.

name: Hegi Career Leaders Program
description: advanced professional development program through the Hegi Family Career Development Center that provides students with access to specialized career counseling sessions to set and track career goals as well as special events such as Lunch with Leadership, Networking Towards the New Year, employer meet and greets, company visits, and other career development presentations.
